page.title: 12CHANGINGTIMES APPLETON WISKE
page.content: Mrs.Ellen Gathergood has lived in Appleton all her life,she remembers that"Every year there was a village sports day with events for all ages. All the children got a silver sixpence and everyone had tea on the green. National events such as the 1935 Jubilee,1945 V.E celebrations and 1953 coronation were always celebrated by comunity fancy dress,sports and a village party.Until 1952 people got their water from pumps,one outside the Nelson,the other near the village shop .Electricity came in 1952 before that houses were lit by parrafin lamps and cooking was done by oil cookers.The school took all the children 5-14. Attendance was poor at harvestime because children stayed off school to help on the farms.Most people had bikes,trains ran from Welbury station and a bus service started in 1928.
